title: Hay testing for cow calf beef producers

tasks.task: Hay quality sampling and analysis for cow-calf operations in Kentucky.
subtasks: Identify and sample hay lots by field and cutting.
Use a coring tool to obtain at least 15-20 cores per hay lot.
Combine cores into a composite sample before submitting for analysis.
Dry sample in a laboratory setting at 55°C overnight.
Weigh and record fresh weight of the sample.
Grind samples through a two-stage mill process to homogenize.
Analyze ground samples using near-infrared spectroscopy for nutrients.
Interpret results to assess hay quality (e.g., crude protein, fiber content).

tasks.task: Utilize hay quality data to adjust feeding programs.
subtasks: Input hay analysis results into the UK cow forage supplement tool.
Consider the stage of production (e.g., lactating vs. dry cows).
Calculate necessary supplemental feed amounts based on hay quality and cow needs.
Adjust feed ration accordingly to prevent nutritional deficiencies in cattle.
